result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J Sippel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Psilocin (<=100 g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(g)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cts 1&2: Costs paid in full from bond posted. Remaining bail returned to poster

-Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
-Provide agent with doctor's name before filling any presctiptions. Keep all presctiptions in original containers.
-Not to possess any drug paraphernalia
 -Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment. Attend any follow up treatment deemed appropriate.
-Submit to random testing
-Submit to DNA sample and pay surchrage
-maintain full time employment (40 hrs/week)

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

supervisions.notes: Finen/costs paid in full. Remaining bond returned to poster.

12/14/2015 Trial
   Exhibits K & L (NOT SCANNED)
       Exhibits located in the Exhibit Room SH 1-4

for Return/Destruction of Exhbits
and Peremptory Challenges

6:23pm (change of court reporters) In session, same appearances, outside the presence of the jury.  Court advises of second question by the jury. Court provides Exhibit A to jury
6:26pm In recess
6:34pm In session, same appearances. Jury brought in with verdict. Court reads verdicts of:
Count 1:  Guilty/ Poss with intent to deliver 
Count 2:    Guilty/ Poss with intent to deliver  
Count 3:  Guilty . Jury polled at request of defense counsel.
6:40pm Jury excused and thanked. State requests judgment on the verdict. Defense requests judgment of acquittal despite the verdict. Court grants State's request and denies Defense request. Court makes findings and grants jugment on the verdict. 
6:41pm Recess for counsel to discuss sentencing option with client.
6:48pm In session, same appearances. Counsel requesting to proceed with sentencing. State gives recommendation. Statement by defense counsel, defendant's father and defendant. 
7:25pm Court renders sentence. Defendant remanded into custody.

Defendant Kyle J Sippel in court with attorney Jeffrey Murrell.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests short adjournment due to witness unavailability. Court denies request. Amended information filed. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea to all counts. 
8:54am Recess
9:11am Jury panel brought in and sworn. 20 jurors called to the box. Voir Dire by the court
9:29am Voir dire by State
9:43am Voir dire by Defense
9:46am Jury striking. 12 Jurors selected. Court thanks and excuses remaining jury panel.
9:54am Jury sworn. Court gives preliminary jury instructions.
10:05am Recess, jury excused until 10:15am
10:20am In session, same appearances, jury present
10:21am Opening statement by State
10:30am Lt. Robert Meyer sworn and testified
10:58am Officer E. Neese sworn and testified
11:03am Recess 
11:23am In session, same appearances. Jury brought in. Continued testimony of Officer Neese
11:26am Analyst Jeff Zwickei sworn and testified. State publishes exhibits to jury and rests.
11:55am Recess for lunch until 1:00pm. Jury excused. Motions to Dismiss by defense heard. Response by State. Based on testimony heard, Court finds the State has met burden and denies request. 
1:05pm In session, same appearances. Jury brought in
1:06pm Opening statement by Defense
1:07pm H.S. sworn and testified
1:25pm R.S. sworn and testified
1:29pm Jury excused. Objection heard.  Court gives ruling
1:35pm Jury brought in, court instructs jury as to striking defense question. 
1:37pm Jury excused. Defendant wishes to testify. Court gives colloquy regarding defendant's choice to testify. Recess for 5 minutes.
1:44pm Back in session, same appearances. Defendant will choose to testify
1:45pm Jury brought in
1:46pm Defendant sworn and testified. Defense rests, no rebuttal by the State. 
2:07pm Jury excused for jury instruction conference
3:18pm In session outside presence of jury for jury instruction conference. Parties provided with verdict forms and instructions with no obejction as to form. 
3:48pm Jury brought in. Court reads jury instructions
4:11pm Closing by the State
4:23pm Closing by Defense
4:28pm Rebuttal by State
4:32pm Remaining instructions given by the Court. 
4:38pm Jury out for deliberation. Court stands in recess.
5:30pm In session outside presence of jury. Court advises of jury question. Exhibits B,C,D,E,F,G, J to jury

Conditions set by court:  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.

Defendant Kyle J Sippel in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time. Def will retain private counsel. State requests $2500 cash bail with conditions.   Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
